title: Woman, in her 20s, arrested after sudden death of baby in Ipswich
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A woman, in her 20s, has been arrested after the sudden death of a baby.

Police are treating the tragedy as unexplained after officers were called to an address in Ipswich, Suffolk, at 10.15am on Tuesday.

Suffolk Police said the infant was taken to Ipswich Hospital by ambulance but was pronounced dead shortly afterwards.

The child's next of kin have been informed.

A police statement said officers had been called to a medical emergency.

The statement added: "The death is currently being treated as unexplained.

(Image: Getty)

"As a result of subsequent enquiries connected to the investigation, a woman in her 20s has been arrested by police.

"She has been taken to Martlesham Police Investigation Centre where she will be questioned."
description: Suffolk Police were called to an address in Ipswich on Tuesday morning after the tragic death
